summary: Completed frontend-only testing for Telegram Feed configurable button visibility. All 6 requested features verified successfully. Landing page correctly hides 'Auto' and 'See all' buttons by default. Admin panel (INTEGRATIONS > Telegram) has the new 'Show Autoplay Button' and 'Show See All Button' toggles in the Toggles section, plus a fully functional 'Header Links' section with add/remove capability.
passed_tests: Landing page: 'Auto' button is NOT visible on ChiPi Community feed (hidden by default via show_autoplay_btn=false)
Landing page: 'See all' button is NOT visible on ChiPi Community feed (hidden by default via show_see_all_btn=false)
Landing page: ChiPi Community section header shows title ('ChiPi Community') and post count ('9 posts') normally
Admin panel: Telegram feed config has 'Show Autoplay Button' toggle in Toggles section (default OFF/gray)
Admin panel: Telegram feed config has 'Show See All Button' toggle in Toggles section (default OFF/gray)
Admin panel: Telegram feed config has 'Header Links' section with description text
Admin panel: 'Add Link Button' button works to add new header link rows
Admin panel: Header link rows show Label and URL input fields with data-testid attributes
Admin panel: Header link remove button (trash icon) works to delete links
Admin panel: Multiple header links can be added (tested with 2 links)
Admin panel: External URLs (https://...) and internal paths (/store) both supported
critical_code_review_comments: Code quality is good - TelegramFeedCard.jsx properly reads show_autoplay_btn, show_see_all_btn, and header_links from container config
HorizontalFeedContainer and VerticalFeedContainer both respect the new flags with proper conditional rendering
Header links correctly detect external vs internal URLs via url?.startsWith('http') check
TelegramAdminModule.jsx properly implements the Toggles section with all new toggles
Header Links editor has proper add/remove functionality with array manipulation
All interactive elements have appropriate data-testid attributes for testing
context_for_next_testing_agent: Telegram feed button visibility feature is complete. Key data-testid attributes: autoplay-toggle-btn, telegram-see-all, toggle-show_autoplay_btn, toggle-show_see_all_btn, add-header-link-btn, header-link-label-{idx}, header-link-url-{idx}, header-link-remove-{idx}. Default values: show_autoplay_btn=false, show_see_all_btn=false, header_links=[]. Admin path: /admin/login → INTEGRATIONS → Telegram → Add/expand container → scroll to Toggles and Header Links sections.
